title: ddcalc.net
description: A degree of difficulty generator for skills and routines in trampoline gymnastics using the FIG Code of Points.
linkAlt: Link to the DD calculator at ddcalc.net

title: LISP Interpreter
description: A metainterpreter for a subset of the LISP programming language. Additional language features are implemented with desugaring.
imageAlt: A stylized depiction of a string of balanced parentheses
linkAlt: Link to the LISP interpreter on Github

title: 2D Light Transport Simulator
description: Collaborated to build raycasting demo that uses reflection, refraction, and diffraction to simulate light transport in a 2D environment.
imageAlt: A stylized depiction of a raycasting simulation
linkAlt: Link to the raycaster on Github

title: Jumpscare
description: A dead-simple project tracking tool that leverages local storage to make ongoing projects and tasks as visible as possible.
imageAlt: An abstract representation of jumpscare's UI

title: StanlEEG
description: A game that procedurally generates and adapts terrain based on live brainwave data. The project won second place at the NatHacks 2022 Hackathon.
imageAlt: The StanlEEG logo. The hooded game character is in the top-left corner, and there is a sheep in the bottom-right corner
linkAlt: Link to the StanlEEG Devpost page

title: MIDI Visualizer
description: A basic MIDI visualizer written in Processing
imageAlt: A styalized depiction of a MIDI visualization
linkAlt: Link to the MIDI Visualizer on Github

title: Music Theory GL
description: A graphics library for illustrating concepts in music theory using keyboard, chromatic circle and circle of fifth diagrams.
imageAlt: An illustration of the circle of fifths
linkAlt: Link to music theory GL on Github

title: Grapher
description: A graphing calculator capable of rendering Riemann sums and indefinite integrals.
imageAlt: A cartesian graph with a section highlighted to form an integral
